item.title: Ordinary Differential Equations
item.description: For a first order differentiation $\frac{\partial f}{\partial t}$, we might have many finite differencing methods. Euler Method For linear first ODE, $$ \frac{dy}{dx} = f(x, y), $$ we can discretize the equation using a step size $\delta x \cdot$ so that the differential equation becomes $$ \frac{y_{n+1} - y_n }{ \delta x } = f(x_n, y_n), $$ which is also written as $$ y_{n+1} = y_n + \delta x \cdot f(x_n, y_n).
